page.title: 06Cannington Remembered
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Krajniewski who is Matthew Krajniewski's granny. We interviewed her to ask her some questions about Cannington when she was little . We asked her what sort of transport there used to be and she said that there were a couple of buses,horse and carts and mostly walking. She told us that where Kellands Agricultural Merchants is there used to be a blacksmiths shop. Then we asked her what the school was like. She said there were about 50 people in the school and the teachers were quite strict. She also said if you got told off you would get the cane on your hand never on your bottom. Then she said that infants used a pencil and the juniors used a quill. She told us that the school fields were allotments.
